meanings.sent1: She had to swink all day in the fields to harvest the crops.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers swinked under the hot sun to finish the building on time.
meanings.sent3: After swinking for hours, she finally collapsed on the couch in exhaustion.
meanings.sent4: The students swinked through the night to complete their project before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The ants swinked tirelessly to gather food for their colony.

meanings.sent1: The swink in the factory was demanding but necessary for production.
meanings.sent2: He appreciated the value of honest swink to earn a living.
meanings.sent3: The swink of the bees in the hive resulted in a sweet reward of honey.
meanings.sent4: The swink of the farmers brought forth a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The swink of the construction workers built the towering skyscraper.

meanings.sent1: Success is often the result of dedicated swink and perseverance.
meanings.sent2: Her achievements were a testament to her relentless swink.
meanings.sent3: The swink put into studying paid off with excellent grades.
meanings.sent4: The swink of the athletes was evident in their performance on the field.
meanings.sent5: The swink of the chef in the kitchen created a masterpiece dish.

meanings.definition: Toil or labor in a wearisome way
meanings.sent1: He swinked away at the task, feeling the weight of exhaustion creeping in.
meanings.sent2: The workers swinked through the night to meet the demanding deadline.
meanings.sent3: She swinked so hard that her muscles ached for days afterward.
meanings.sent4: The explorers swinked through the dense jungle, facing numerous challenges.
meanings.sent5: Despite the obstacles, they continued to swink towards their goal.
